Accessing StarTeam Servers

To interoperate StarTeam with Microsoft Project, you must be able to access the appropriate StarTeam server configuration. Ask your administrator for the name or IP address and the endpoint for the TCP/IP (Sockets) protocol for the computer that runs the server configuration.

Understanding Server Access Rights

You do not need any server access rights to synchronize users and import work records. However, to export, synchronize or unlink tasks, you must have permission to see, create, and modify those tasks. Access rights can be assigned to individual tasks, tasks within a specific folder, tasks within a specific view, and tasks within a specific project. These rights can be overridden based on group privileges or by virtue of having created the task.

Using the Same Server Description Name

A server description is the name assigned to a particular StarTeam server configuration in StarTeam. However, StarTeam and Microsoft Project use server descriptions differently. For StarTeam, the description of a particular server configuration can differ from workstation to workstation because the application connects to it based on other information (the name or address of the computer that runs the server and the protocol and endpoint used to connect to that computer). Microsoft Project does not have this capability, but relies on the server description alone. As a result, if project managers use more than one workstation to connect to the same server configuration and access data for a Microsoft project, the server descriptions on each workstation must be the same. Otherwise, Microsoft Project does not connect properly.

Adding a Server

The StarTeam Microsoft Project Integration comes with its own server list (StarTask.st). If you have Microsoft Project files that you used with earlier versions of this product, you must use the same names for server descriptions that were used in the past.

If you will be working on a project that another project manager has already synchronized, ask that manager for the server description name and add it to your list of StarTeam servers.

The following procedure explains how to add a server configuration for projects that have already been synchronized. This procedure requires you to open a new project that you will later discard. Its only purpose is to add a server to the server list.

To add a server:

  1. From Microsoft Project, open a new project file.

  2. Select StarTeam > Sync StarTeam Users. The Connection Wizard: Select Server dialog appears.

  3. Click Add Server. The StarTeam Server dialog appears.

    1. In the Server Description text box, enter the description to be used by everyone who will access this server for a specific project. If a project is updated from more than one workstation, each workstation must use the same server description for the StarTeam server or operations with Microsoft Project will fail.

    2. In the Server Address text box, enter the name of the computer on which the server runs or its IP address. You can browse for the name if you prefer. The TCP/IP (Sockets) protocol is preselected.

    3. In the Endpoint text box, enter the endpoint that the StarTeam server uses for this protocol.

    4. Click OK to return to the Connection Wizard: Select Server dialog. Your new server description appears in the server list and can now be used with other projects.

  4. If your sole purpose was to add a server description:

    1. Click Cancel.

    2. Close the new project without saving it.
